website_summaries.verdict: Look no further than the Cisco Valet Plus if you want to get a robust wireless home network up and running effortlessly.
pros: The Cisco Valet Plus is by far the most easy to use wireless router to date
It also has great range, decent performance, and comes with an effective wireless networking management software for home users
cons: The Cisco Valet Plus doesn't support dual-band and it has no USB port for storage or print-serving features

website_summaries.verdict: Ever wanted a router that's a fast performer but still easy enough for networking newbies to set up? Meet the Cisco Valet Plus.
pros: Unprecedented ease of setup in a router
Feature set perfect for a home/family network
Remarkably easy to get other devices on a network connected to it with innovative Easy Setup Key
cons: Throughput still not highest we have seen in this router class

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up that no written documentation is required. Just plug the router in to a power outlet and connect it to your cable box, then plug the USB dongle into your computer. Everything else is pretty much automatic. To connect other computers, you can either push the button on the base unit when Windows requests the passphrase, or you can just plug the USB dongle into the new computer. It's easy to change the default network name and passphrase if you wish. I've intalled several of these, and they just work. The one at my mother-in-law's house has been working nonstop for about a year and a half now, with no issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Hackworth

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup but
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router because the wifi from the modem supplied by Roadrunner was having trouble getting reception in the next room, where we have the TV, treadmill, etc. Setup was incredibly easy. It took absolutely no knowledge of routers. Directions are simple and there isn't much to do. However, reception in the next room is not much better with this router than with the Roadrunner modem. Maybe there's something strange about the construction of our house, who knows. But some devices are doing a little better with the Cisco router, some a little worse. But from what I am seeing, this does not have particularly good range.
customer_reviews.author: Finnegan's Father

customer_reviews.title: Great---except for online help
customer_reviews.text: I had a little trouble setting up. I changed the password and then couldn't get the original computer to connect to router. I spent TOO MUCH time on the phone with tech. She was no help, thought the firmware was corrupted. For $30 I could get the firmware updated online. For a mere $85 I could get a new router. I declined and we hung up. So I fiddled with the set-up key myself. Uninstalled and reinstalled. Lo and behold, the Cisco valet works just fine. Long and short, the online tech support leaves much to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Super Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works (almost) exactly as advertised. Setup required one phone call to tech support, during which it was determined that I had not completely re-set my cable modem (it has a backup battery, so simply disconnecting the power cord wasn't enough - I had to remove the backup battery, too). Once that was done, connectivity was instananeous, and setting up the 2 other computers (a Mac and a PC) in the house literally took 5 minutes in total. Connection speed to the other 2 machines seems awesome - much quicker than the router I replaced, and when combined with the simplicity of the Valet Plus, this makes for a great product. Highly recommended - well worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: ZD

customer_reviews.title: Nice Router
customer_reviews.text: I can't testify for the wireless part.Only on the wired.I just installed this unit about a week or so.The other router was finally going south.No problems as of yet,I have had it on 24/7 with no reboots or problems.Some advice on security.One make sure you change your password to log in to the router.Two,Go to the;Advance Configuration section.DISABLE the (UPnP) Universal Plug & Play section.For more information for the UPnP go to your favorite search site & type it in. I recommend this product.BTW,I did not use the usb supplied to set this router up.
customer_reviews.author: chowur

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: My old Netgear router just wasn't up to the job anymore. I was constantly dropping signal and internet was shoddy at best. Saw some mixed reviews on this one but decided to try it out. Plugged in the provided setup key and a few minutes later I was up and running. Walked around the house with the computer to test the signal and even in the back corner of my house furthest away from the router, I only lost one bar of signal. Hasn't dropped internet yet and it's on all the time. It even has a guest network so you don't have to give your password out to everyone at the party. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Terrible wireless range
customer_reviews.text: I have a setup with my internet connection in the basement, and computers in the basement, the first and second floors. The second floor computer has had trouble making the connection because of poor signal. Based on reviews, I thought this CISCO is a good upgrade to my current Netgear, which is about 3 year old. Setup is very good, easy, probably because I started from a Windows 7 PC. Have not tried the Windows XP PC yet. After the installation, I am very surprised that the CISCO's range is worse than my Netgear. It is not even as good as a LinkSys, a 6 year old device. Range is the only reason I upgraded. Completely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not much of techno geek. I'm always very happy when I can just plug something in and have it work with minimal effort. I found that rare thing in the Valet Plus wireless router. I don't think it took me more 15 minutes to unpack the device, plug it in, connect my internet cable, and plug in the USB setup key. In no time I had my computer working wireless and by the end of the night my wireless printer, iPhone, iPad, and Roku were up and running with zero issues. For no other reason that I would highly recommend the Valet router. The great security features are just added benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: This Router is Dog!
customer_reviews.text: I have windows xp service pack 3 with 2 printers attached to a simple (Cisco!) 8-port switch. Connected the Cisco Valet to the Cisco switch and installed the software using the thumb "key" that comes with this router. Results? Printers stopped printing. Internet connection was lost. Hours on the phone with Hewlett Packard and Cisco. Total disaster! Recovered by disconnecting everything and doing a windows "check point" to a calendar date a few days before. Shame on Cisco for releasing an untested or poorly tested product. Very surprising indeed! Daniel - South Florida
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Welker

customer_reviews.title: nice medium grade router
customer_reviews.text: if you are only running a couple of laptops and tablets off of this, its perfect! i would suggest for 5 things or less. if you are going to go wireless with more than 5 components i would definitely go with something else. an asus router is about the best, but they are quite a bit higher in cost, but they are worth it. but it is a great little router for people who dont have a lot of things running then it is fasts and reliable
customer_reviews.author: emerald

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because someone said it was so easy to set up that your grandmother could do it. Well, I couldn't. Because my computer is elderly, the automatic set up would not work. I had to call customer service. I reached a real person very quickly. The wonderful woman I spoke to stayed on the phone with me for over 40 minutes helping set up the system. She was very knowledgeable and clear in her instructions. She even told me what I needed to do when I bought a new computer. The router now works perfectly and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Machine was easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a few years before Comcast combined its modem and router. Machine was easy to set up and use. I had to restart it every once in a while when the internet would kick out, but I think that is fairly normal.
customer_reviews.author: Traffic Cone

customer_reviews.title: New item acutally old
customer_reviews.text: It would have been nice to know that this item was three years old and not available for customer support from Cisco. Although Cisco was nice and allowed me to receive their support since I had just purchased the item I was informed that this router was not supported for the last three years. I thought I was getting a new item- not just new in the package but a new item now. Ah well. It seems to be working fine now and hopefully I won't need to call customer support again.
customer_reviews.author: Margo I. Akamine

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice and everything but the biggest problem is when you ...
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice and everything but the biggest problem is when you have a whole bunch of devices connected to it .it disconnects from the Internet .The solution is you have to go back in restart the router again It's very annoying specially when you are in the middle of watching movie in movie freezes .
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Raza

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Simple
customer_reviews.text: The router was very easy to configure and setup. If I had wanted to use the standard Cisco settings, it would have been extremely easy. All you have to do is follow the 3 steps outline in the guide and you're up and running! However, I was using the router as a wireless access point to my existing network. So it took a few extra steps to customize, but it works great! I've only had it a month so there have been no product support issues. I have 3 computers using the router, 2 are running Windows XP and 1 is running Windows7.
customer_reviews.author: Frank ("Darth")

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Router - Worse Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I called with a problem two days after receiving CISCO Valet Plus Router. . . . The first thing the tech told me was that my “unit was out of warranty” and I would have to pay for assistance! I spent over two hours on the telephone with customer service with the call ending with my unit being even more broken than before.. The "tech" did not even know what the "key" was. I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: zwriter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!  Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time wireless router user with no (zero) prior knowledge. I read the easy to understand instructions and followed them exactly. Also, at the same time, I purchased a Samsung blu-ray player with built-in wireless ability and quite a few apps. Netflix to my TV was the reason for both purchases. I am happy to report that the Cisco wireless router and the blu-ray worked the first time and I am now enjoying Netflix. I have nothing negative to say about the Cisco-Valet Plus Wireless Router.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Best Experience Ever
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a product that met every one of the advertised claims ... until I purchased this Cisco-Valet Wireless router. Worked perfectly ... right out of the box. Just inserted the supplied thumb drive into the computer UBS port and POW, my wireless was operational! This is a no-brainer, especially for all of us generation-ally challenged folks without a tech background. I have installed routers before and it was not a pleasant experience. This time, with the Valet, it was a real joy. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Service, unusable product
customer_reviews.text: It's not your fault. It arrived in good time, well packed and protected etc. I wrapped it for a Christmas gift and all went well. However, A Router won't work in our building. I didn't know that until I hooked it up and it took over a major portion of the building's internet program and everything quit working. Needless to say it was a bit of a mess. I will check to see if it can be returned, but I don't have the shipping box etc., As I say, I am not upset with Amazon, but it isn't working.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Haun.

customer_reviews.title: Decent router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router at least three years ago and it is still alive and kicking. I haven't had any particular problems with it but I deducted one star because I live in an older one bedroom apartment with thick walls and keep my router in the living room and sometimes I don't get much signal in my bedroom. I am very pleased with how incredibly easy it was to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Sheep

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I used to own a Cisco router. It had good reliability in the beginning, not so much when we got rid of it. It kept crashing and we'd have to reset it. So I got a new computer and this router. It came with the easy setup key. It was so easy to set up! I had an entire new wireless internet channel in under 30 minutes. And I've had it for maybe a month or two now. I've had absolutely no problems with it. I love the ability to control the settings on any computer. I would highly recommend this product. Thank you Cisco!
customer_reviews.author: G. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work. I called and talked with Cisco customer service multiple times over many days adding up to HOURS and they were unable to help. After adjusting every setting feasible they finally sent me an RMA to return the product. A replacement wouldn't have shipped until the faulty unit was received and even then they were going to send an identical unit. The sole purpose of needing the router was to use my Ipad and Iphone. This router only worked for my laptop. Useless. I returned it and purchased a different brand and in a matter of 10 minutes wifi worked and with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxx

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Great range.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this model for a couple of years so I purchased another one at an unbeatable price for a friend. We have a 3 level home and with exception of spotty coverage in the basement everywhere else has excellent reception. We have several wireless devices and a wireless printer that are sometimes all connected at once including guest users. I know this may not be the best one out there but it works very well in my home. The setup is as easy as can be.
customer_reviews.author: Caragitana

customer_reviews.title: extraordinary piece of equipment for today's networking demands
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and carries a lot of pride in its networking capabilities for the price ! The 802.11 draft N-protocol made a huge difference from the Super-G which showed obselete in comparison. I personally would recommend this router in every house hold or small buisiness environmnets. Reliable, Highly available and ease of administration and forget about me (Don't bother anymore) equipment ! I am lucky to have bought it and using it in my house Thanks Ihsan
customer_reviews.author: Ihsan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of routers over the last 15 years and this one seems to be working quite well so far. Nice looking router which I did not use the USB key to set up the network. I just went into the router settings using my browser and it was a piece of cake to set up. I have at least 12 things hooked up to the router and they all picked up the IP's without issue. My Obihai phone works and sounds great. The netgear switch works fine with it. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: JakeHall

customer_reviews.title: died after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This router was easy to install and configure. In the last month(September, 2012) my internet service slowed down significantly. After connecting my desktop computer directly to my cable modem, I determined the Valet router was causing the slowdown. I then tried to reset/reboot the router hoping this would solve the problem. After it was disconnected from the power source and then plugged in, it quit working at all. I am moving on to another brand of router.
customer_reviews.author: johnlaw

customer_reviews.title: Margaritaville Shop
customer_reviews.text: The Cisco-Valet Plus Wireless Router works great with all of my Laptops. Windows 7 didnt need the connector. It started up with the Cisco wizard. The Vista Home Basic needed the Connector to restart again each time you turn it off. And though my Windows XP network icon shows 100% connected, I am trying to resolve the BCMLogin issue which may be preventing me to launch the Internet Explorer. I love the product and CISCO has been around for many years. I do trust their products. I am also working to route a WIN CE 6 to the internet. But need little more researh on the Moble size operating system.
customer_reviews.author: Margaritaville

customer_reviews.title: Wireless speed goes up and down
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest router I've ever set up, but when working on my laptop, the connection speed will vary from 1mb to 54mb. Invariably, if I'm trying to do work on a website and upload files or such, the speed slows to a crawl. I've contacted customer support and done all they suggested, plus looked on their forums for other solutions, but here I sit, writing this and getting ready to send over a 1mbps connection. I'd return it if I still had all the original packaging.
customer_reviews.author: CBlue

customer_reviews.title: Works well, recommended
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product through Amazon to replace an old router which was no longer working properly. It arrived quickly the set up was very clear and straight forward, I had one small issue for which I contacted Cisco support. I had a very short wait and my question was ansswered quickly and everything fired up and worked fine. The unit is attractive and functions very well. The price was resonanable and the it shipped right away from Amazon. I recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Carl U.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be easier
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old Linksys that would not cooperate with my new Canon printer. The price was the lowest I'd seen in my research (Best Buy, Office Depot). It was a snap to insert the install thumb drive which walked me through the install for my Mac and then the printer and our two iPhones. Easy to use with clear instructions contained in the install drive. Also has a nice guest feature so your visitors can connect separate of your primary link.
customer_reviews.author: Road King

customer_reviews.title: Well yes and no
customer_reviews.text: For straight ahead wireless or wired installation no problem as long as you follow the simple instructions. My wife the hacker ended up not using the required install dongle and was on the unsecured guest network. Also have two USB wireless modules:  which is about half the price of the Valet units with the same function. I got them to work - but the easy valet part was out the window.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Gallaher

customer_reviews.title: Valet Plus So Easy To Setup
customer_reviews.text: This router is so easy to setup compared to previous Linksys routers. Just plug in the router, connect the modem and plug the provided thumb drive in a wireless laptop or a desk top that is also plugged into the router. A very simple user screen opens that does everything for you. You name your network, create a password and that's it. Within a minute I was connected. This is the first router I have owned that I didn't have to call customer support to get it to work. You can change the name and password of your network anytime, just plug in the thumb drive and the interface opens.
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, for a router. Works perfectly and has better range than the D Link it replaced. I use a slingbox and their customer service said that Cisco routers were not supported, which I thought was pretty stupid. Called Cisco support and they could not have been nicer helping me open a port for the Slingbox. Everything has worked flawlessly since I have owned it, including wireless printing. I highly recommend this model, if only for their great product support!
customer_reviews.author: cap10jim

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Cisco discontinued this line a while ago, but this model was a flagship (cutting edge) version at the time. So it is more than capable! Still does circles around newer models twice its price. If you are a tech savvy person, go ahead and put DD-WRT firmware on this bad boy. It is hard to find the instructions (most references say it isn't supported yet - but they are old... it is supported). Trust me it works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ellingson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The Cisco Valet Plus was really easy to use. It is literally a plug and play device that hardly needs any IT knowledge to operate. In addition to being easy to operate, it has great range and good security. It offers guest access with a seperate password than the rest of the home network. It also seems to be able to handle multiple items at once. The best part of this product for me though, is its size. it is small and unobtrusive in a world of tech clutter.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: setup and working great
customer_reviews.text: I have given this product a 4 star rating; because it is still to early to give it a full 5 star rating. I'm really happy with this product; the setup was fast and simple. I had a previous cisco m10 router and gave it to my daughter, I purchased another one for myself. This Product arrived on time and in excellent condtion. If you want something inexpensive and simple to operate; this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really like this, it is faster than our other wireless router. I did have to call customer service to help me set it up, but after that all went well. I wasn't sure where to look for the router in my computer so I could reset the password and user ID. I did lose wifi once, but I'm guessing it was due to the router needing to be updated. So after I updated it, it was easy to get all going again. So far it seems fairly reliable.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Cisco router
customer_reviews.text: Set up was a no brainer and range is sufficient. Would recommend this to anyone because of ease of setup and use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Savage

customer_reviews.title: Simply perfect
customer_reviews.text: This router is easy to use and has increased my signal strength by at least 1 bar over my Netgear. I have been using it for 6 months now with absolutely no issues. Easy to configure too! After replacing two Netgear's I decided it was time to go with a new product and since Cisco is tops in my book I went that route. I am just glad I was able to get one for such a low low price because it is worth much more.
customer_reviews.author: W. Dini

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great product for even the most computer illiterate person!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never ever in my life want to mess with Router and modem. So this was my first attempt at it, and let me tell you. I was super thrilled!!! I did it! seriously took me half an hour to set it up on my laptop and then the other four computers around the house. It works great, and no internet disruption so even with all the computers running. My house is 3300 sq/ft, and two levels so this router really have a very good range. I don't know why I didnt' buy this product sooner!
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME, VERY USER FRIENDLY
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Cisco-Valet Plus Wireless Router to replace my linsky router after my ISP informed me that my usage was extremely high. When I checked, I realized that someone was tapping my internet, so I wanted a very secure router. Cisco has WAP and WAP2 which provides better security than my WEP Linsky. It installed very simply ... great router, SOooooo simple to install. You won't regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce from NJ

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it was advertised as easy to install. I have set up wireless routers before but I still had to call tech support several times (once at one residence and again after moving) to get the router working. I will say the tech support was helpful and knowledgeable, and the router works fine once installed, but I don't feel like it's worth the extra money for the no-fuss installation they promise!
customer_reviews.author: Daver400

customer_reviews.title: Works but range not that great
customer_reviews.text: This was really easy to set up. The USB set up was really simple. My only complaint is the range. I had an old cisco wireless "B" router that I was replacing. I put the new one in exactly the same position and lost approximately 20% of my range. I'd been told that the new "N" technology would be transmitted farther, but that's not the case with this router. It's stable, and I haven't had to reset it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Who Knows

customer_reviews.title: Nice router
customer_reviews.text: The Cisco Valet Plus Wireless Router set up immediately and flawlessly. Range was not as good as some of the reviews indicated but adequate (about 50-75 feet through several walls). It creates its own network name which in my case was rather nice and poetic sounding. I would recommend this router especially for the novice and intermediate user and unquestionably the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Knack

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one. The other one lasted for about 4 years. It is very simple to set up and no tech rep is needed. It is a shame that this is discontinued from Linksys. This is my spare modem. I am using a Linksys EA6900 now. When this unit goes out I will go back to the Cisco Valet Plus.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Piece of Equipment
customer_reviews.text: We had ours for over 6 years now and it's working like a champ. Great signal strength all over the house. NO complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Sister

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This router has prevented my going to dangerous Web sites many times and, for that, I'm relieved. My one complaint is that software development for the software to communicate with the router has stopped, dead and I'm unable to determine if the product's been sold to another company.
customer_reviews.author: george3095

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up! I really thought it would be a lot harder to set up WI-FI in my house but this router made it super easy. I have had no troubles with it at all. I thought I would have to buy something to make my super old desktop pc WI-FI ready as well but this router comes with the ability to connect up to 4 devices via cable if needed. That saved me time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Valet Plus WIreless Router
customer_reviews.text: No written instructions, but its all on the included thumb drive. Easy to set up, IF you follow the instructions to the letter. Had a problem with the set up on a third PC, called the customer service line, it was answered on the second ring, and I got the BEST help ever from an extremely well trained lady in the Philippines. Cisco is taking customer support serious.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A

customer_reviews.title: Beware this comes with no CISCO support!!!
customer_reviews.text: The marketing material says easy hook up and connection. After following the prompts the automatic connection process stopped and I was directed to call CISCO. The fine sales lady at CISCO informed me she could configure the router remotely for $9.99 since I didn't buy the product from the manufacturer. If I did buy from the manufacturer I would have free support for 1 year. She was unable to provide an answer for why the product did not connect as described in the marketing material. She talked me through manually setting up the router and it works. Connecting was not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Matt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in coverage and speed
customer_reviews.text: I just order a Cisco Valet Plus and will be returning it. The so-called "easy install" USB stick included didn't work on my iMac, so I had to use Cisco customer service to configure. The router has disappointing coverage in my 2,500 sq. foot home, and isn't fast enough for streaming video. I average download speeds on my cable modem of approximately 49 mbps, but the Cisco router only delivers approximately 16 mbps to my wireless devices, including my Apple TV. If you need a router to stream HD video from services like Netflix, as I do, this is not the router for you. Bottom line, there's a reason it sells for $29.
customer_reviews.author: Ward B.

customer_reviews.title: Bricked, sort of
customer_reviews.text: Unit died 3 days after warranty expired. Of course Cisco was of no help then. It sat on a shelf for a month, then I saw that DD-WRT finally had a build for it. I plugged it in, it sort of worked. But I was able to do the install and now it runs great. It's a great test unit for WRT, but not very useful for my home network as I switched to dual-band equipment.
customer_reviews.author: DuWayne

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to go with a laptop and ereaders and it has been perfect. It was a little difficult to setup for me because I am technologically ignorant. I did call tech support and they walked me through every step, despite by dumb questions. The tech support was wonderful and once we got started the setup was very easy. It has been 100% reliable since I bought it about 1 month ago.
customer_reviews.author: GardenGirl

customer_reviews.title: As Wi-Fi's go ..Good Job!!
customer_reviews.text: My 54G was with out peer until it was replaced by this device. Installed well (no fuss), works very well, cost was no more outrageous than all the other 'must have' Electronic Devices. May it last forever! or until there is a Type P or Q or .....? Update: This had turned out to be "Happy Camper' buy which is to say 'fair cost, installs easily and long lived'.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Because I have a complicated set up at home, the USB auto-load setup didn't get me up and running instantly as it will for most. I had to call tech support and....get ready for it...the young woman who helped me was knowledgeable, friendly and fast. I was up and flying in under 2 minutes. This is the best wireless network I've ever had and I could not be more please with the service.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Senechal

customer_reviews.title: my input
customer_reviews.text: The Cisco-Valet Plus router installation was surprisingly easy. I was able to get my wife's xp and my windows 7 computers operational. I did have a glitch getting my Canon wireless printer to work I had to do enter the SSID password word a couple times on the printer side. I also use this router with my wireless video adapter for DirecTV on demand .
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Its cool. for now :)
customer_reviews.text: Its seems to be ok for now. However my roommate doesn't get the strongest signal in the back of the apartment where her bed room is. The tower is facing the front end of the apartment. So that's where we keep the unit. It works well with my Wifi TV. Only 3 times we had a signal problem. I think it was more internet company related than device malfunction.
customer_reviews.author: Kennie

customer_reviews.title: Good, but too "consumer-ish"
customer_reviews.text: The router works well, but the packaging is over-kill. Seems as though they're trying to "present" the router when you open the box. A Marketing trick to head-off buyer's remorse. The USB setup key is also somewhat gimmicky, but it works. Only issue with these "extras" is the added cost for no real product use benefit. As I sadi, the router does seem to work quite well though.
customer_reviews.author: DB Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router based on product reviews here on the Amazon site as well as from PC Magazine and Cnet and I have not been disappointed. My old NetGear router had been acting up for several weeks and I finally gave up with the constant re-setting that was required to maintain a signal. The Cisco Valet-Plus was very easy to setup and I've been using it for over a month with no issues. I use it for work, personal, and for my PS3. I've streamed movies using NetFlix with excellent results. Overall this product is exactly what I was expecting and the price(under $100 at the time) was also right on the money.
customer_reviews.author: bpd123

customer_reviews.title: Good...when it works
customer_reviews.text: When my first Valet Plus stopped working, I decided to buy another one because of how easy it was to install and set up. I wish I had taken the time to do a little more research and to find a more reliable router. Every few weeks or months, my internet speed slows down to a crawl or stops working altogether, and I have to reinstall the router (sometimes multiple times) before it will work again. I won't buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: writergeek313

customer_reviews.title: dismayed
customer_reviews.text: I specifically purchased this with the idea that I would pay a little more money for ease of use. We have a new baby, so I wanted to spend time with her, rather than dealing with the router. Both are cute, and the router does not spit up, but I'd still rather spend time with the kid. The router did not work out of box like I had hoped. When computers were connected via Ethernet cabling, it worked fine. But my wife's laptop and our iPhones would not stay on the network, forcing us to retry all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Thoma

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and has a very good range
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to install and use. I had one that I liked, so I bought one for a friend who had been unsuccessful in trying to install a much more expensive router at his mother's house. This one installed quickly, and the range is very good..
customer_reviews.author: In California

customer_reviews.title: Valet Plus
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an update to the older Cisco-Valet, which started having to be reset several times a day. Very nice. Much more coverage area wise and streams much faster than the older one. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Booyah!

customer_reviews.title: Warning Will Robinson!!!!!!!! Warning!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cisco Connect Incompatible with Mac OS X 10.8 Mountain Lion - I didn't do my home work before I bought it, but $29.99 with free shipping was a great deal. I need to decide if I'm going to return it or give it as Christmas present. The Amazon description gives a generic statement that it is Mac compatible but only for Mac OS 10.7 or later. Cysco has no upgrade available either
customer_reviews.author: Bud Bilko

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: Review of multiple wireless routers resulted in this purchase from Amazon, which offered the router at a price that could not be equaled. This is the second Cisco wireless router we have owned. Cisco customer service is excellent. Extensive research determined that the Cisco Valet Wireless Router was the best wireless router for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Diabolo

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: Just as easy as everyone said. Plugged in the USB key and it did all the work; took about five minutes. My son configured his laptop even quicker. Sets up security WPA-2 parameters and passwords automatically but makes them easy to retrieve and change. Even gives you an easy password for guests to temporarily log onto your connection without having to dictate an impossibly long, convoluted password. Valet is located on second floor and I'm usually on laptop on main floor. No problems with connection or bars and has actually improved computer's speed. Have only had it a few days but no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Cisco Valet Plus this past October. It has worked great. I have not had a dropped connection once. Prior to owning the Valet Plus I had a DLink router that dropped connections all the time and it cost almost twice as much. I would recommend this product to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: ptldy072

customer_reviews.title: You know, it was ...
customer_reviews.text: ...just amazing how easy this was to install. I am no techno-crat by any means. Yeah, I used to hook up my old stereo, back in the day...and I can pretty much figure where wires go, today as well, on all this computer stuf...but this was just so easy it made me smile. Get one, you won't be sorry...
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I asked our IT guy which router I should get because I have previously had trouble setting them up. He told me this one practically sets itself up and he was right! I have had it for sometime now and I have had no problems at all. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a good router that's easy to setup and works all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Moore

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this product with no real clue about this kind of device. To my amazement, this product was very easy to setup, and has been working perfect from day one. I have connected my laptop, televisions, smart phone, and gaming systems and all work perfect with this device. I highly recommend this product for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NYCman

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent reception
customer_reviews.text: I followed the direction for setting it up. Granted, plugging the included thumb drive made it easy. However, the reception and speed were much worse than my original OLD basic linksys. Furthermore, the reception flutters without my moving away nor toward the router. When I called customer service, the person hung up on me after impatiently asking for information. Bad service, Bad product. I am returning this router.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lien

customer_reviews.title: Has been acting up lately
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit skeptical buying a refurb piece and it is proving it self to be right. it has been very flaky at times and now my partners work win7 laptop refuses to even connect to it. Keeps dropping packets and connections during night time and goes into Hibrnate even though setting are set not to hibernate
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: This refurbish wireless router devices is great in using multiple IPads, IPhone and laptop at the same time. It is so easy to keep changing the password that the guest login password is not even necessary. You can set a Permanent password and let your friends or family use the guest password.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great, with a little help.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third router I have had. The others were Linksys, inexpensive models that seemed to wearout after a few months and drop connections. So far, this one works great and has very good range thru a big house. Time will tell. I did need to call customer service for help setting it up. They were prompt and quickly helped me set it up. So far, I am very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jackpine

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Has been a great router. Easy to set up and make changes to the menu if needed. Range has been excellent. Have on 2nd floor of house and am able to access in basement on opposite side of house. Likewise, can access any where on outside deck of house which wraps around 2/3 of house.
customer_reviews.author: cwd

customer_reviews.title: Tolerable
customer_reviews.text: functionality and web interface is understandable, it is always a little difficult to tell where the bottle neck is when there are 10 plus devices running off this little machine. Seems to manage well enough, nothing a reboot cannot handle.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.LindenWillow

customer_reviews.title: easy set-up and great range
customer_reviews.text: I found this on Amazon for my father when his router went out then my router bombed so I bought the same one. Both of us had no problem installing and it works perfectly. We both use other computers wireless and without problem on this router. I have two story house and signal is strong throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Tina B

customer_reviews.title: No Problems and Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: My Cisco Valet was so easy to install and have had no problems whatsoever with it. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Loves Books

customer_reviews.title: A good budget router.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the router for 4 years and it works flawlessly. I bought a second one for a friend and his works well too. Very easy to setup and configure for the novice user.
customer_reviews.author: ~DR

customer_reviews.title: Cisco plus valet
customer_reviews.text: This product is working great for me. I did call their customer support as I was unsure as to how to connect my broadband cables to the Cisco, but the man who hepled me was wonderful and he stayed on the phone with me until I was finished. I am very happy. The reception is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineG

customer_reviews.title: Wireless made easy
customer_reviews.text: This router is ridiculously easy to set up- connect router to your cable modem connect your laptop to the router insert the included Cisco 'key' in a USB port ( just like a thumb drive) the setup wizard opens and you make a few clicks wait a minute you're connected
customer_reviews.author: BDJones

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Valet
customer_reviews.text: The product does all that it is advertised to do. The set up did not work as outlined in the directions. I called the support phone number listed and that was absolutely worthless. The person who spoke very little English could not help me at all. After being on the line with him for over an hour, I ended the call, went on the website, and figured out the problems myself. This is a wonderful product that needs work in the support area.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: has never crashed
customer_reviews.text: great router, easy to install and satisfying speeds. it really has all that is needed and has never crashed, not even once (we have been using it for about 1.5 years now). signal strength is ok for our 1 bedroom apartment
customer_reviews.author: Antony

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but setup does not seem geared for mac
customer_reviews.text: The product has worked perfectly fine since setup. The setup itself did not work as simply as expected. I plugged in the setup "key" (usb designed to link your computer to the router), and nothing happened. Customer service was helpful and within 20minutes it was up and running. I do wish that it had a greater range, because it seems to get weak around 25-30 feet laterally away. Definitely worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M Roden

customer_reviews.title: the ghost of steve jobs
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Belkin router that is slow and the older security protocol so I wanted to upgrade. This product was advertised as mac & windows compatible. On the box it indicated a problem with mac lion 10.7 so I went on their chat site. The lady instructed me to manually configure the router so I followed her instructions. The internet worked but I wasted the day trying to re-install my wireless hp printer. I finally went back to the Cisco chat site. I was informed that he was not trained in printers but for a fee a network engineer could fix the issue. I plugged-in my old Belkin router and the world went back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: georgia

customer_reviews.title: great internet to use and somewhat easy as well
customer_reviews.text: I plugged in the router and put the included usb easy installation guide in and it wouldn't work, I called the tech support and had to have an hour conversation to learn my computer was too outdated to use the easy installation so I just used another one and it worked quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: In the past I had used a number of wireless routers in my home that simply did not have the range required to operate on a reliable basis. This router installed very easily and has excellent range. I won't get into a lengthy review, it simply works as advertised and I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fail

customer_reviews.title: Could only apply parental controls to 5 devices
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically for the parental controls - but it only allowed control of up to 5 devices. Firmware upgrade and reinstalling software did not help. Between laptops, an xbox and ipod touches and a few kids you can get to 5 quickly. Also if you use the advanced settings to configure the router then you couldn't use the parental control feature after that. Linksys customer service - at least they have a toll free number - but I spent a lot of time on the phone without the problem being resolved.
customer_reviews.author: kla

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup Router for Wide Coverage
customer_reviews.text: The router takes longer to unpack than it does to setup. The USB "Setup Assistant" does all the work for you. You only need to change the name of your system if you don't like the one assigned. You can also setup Parental controls as to where the router will let you surf the web (This function was NOT tested by this adult reviewer). It provided (for me) wider and stronger signal coverage than the Linksys WRT610 router. The best thing about this product is it ease of setup and the short time from box to working unit.
customer_reviews.author: William W. Gorman Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Expired Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I discovered too late - that this products warranty had expired. How can you sell products to people knowing full well that they are old merchandise! I also had trouble with setting up the router & had to have someone contact the company (that's how I found out about the expired warranty). I am very unhappy with all of this.
customer_reviews.author: RoseAnn Oldham

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I must say that it is done the job for a few years now without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: G. Chester

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Valet Plus
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Netgear router because of the claim it was so easy to set up. And it is true...It was very easy to set up. however, my client email program is not sending out, but can receive...a call to tech support failed to sove the problem and I have been using the ISP's webmail to send out, not a biggie from home. I'm sure the problem will eventually be solved, just need to find the right switch. Otherwise I am pleased with the product, connections are simple, I even have my Samsung Blue-Ray player connected.
customer_reviews.author: ClarkD

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all.
customer_reviews.text: After my previous router stopped working I decided to look for one on the Cyber Monday deals. After searching I found this one for a decent price. It said it was easy to install, but what really caught my attention was that it didn't need a disc to install and just used a setup inside an USB which was convenient because discs tend to get scratched as time passes. The design is great and doesn't take much space. The signal while not a very long range, is great for what it offers. I recommend this product for anyone looking for a decent router that doesn't cost much.
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: Limitations on parental controls
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice unit that will avoid most users having to access the native set-up scripts for the router. HOWEVER, what they don't tell you is the software can only handle 5 devices for parental controls. If you consider this needs to include mobile devices and game systems...anything with a browser that uses wifi...then that is a very unhelpful limitation. The support centre were helpful but the workaround involves uninstalling the Cisco software and configuring each user directly on the router. If I wanted to do that I wouldn't have bought this product! Come on Cisco, 5 devices? Really?!
customer_reviews.author: Nigel S

customer_reviews.title: Good product, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I had some difficulty with the addition of computers to the home network that was created and had to spend some time with tech support. They were great and walked me through it and showed me the error of my ways. Once up and running, I have had no problems and would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: It's nearly as easy as they say. I had no trouble with my PC. I also set one up for my mom on her Mac and it was just a little bit harder, but that's probably because I'm not used to Macs. If you just follow the on-screen directions, it's a snap.
customer_reviews.author: A Regular Mom

customer_reviews.title: Tough Installation
customer_reviews.text: I bought shortly after introduction. Installation was a problem on four different computers (two Macs, two Windows). While Customer Service spent 3+ hours with me without complaint, I had read and believed the easy installation lemonade. It turns out that if you have other antivirus / trojan / etc. software already installed, you have a problem and need to remove that software first. Once installed, it works OK, but not significantly more range than the previous Linksys. As background: While I know PCs and operating systems, I am not a router whiz.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: VERY EASY TO SET UP! TOOK ME 5 MINS! Hooked up my xbox, laptop, my step moms kindle and her ipad! No problems at all! .... The only thing I didnt like was there is no cable hook up for the actually internet so you have to use the internet modem that you are using now with your internet.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah David

customer_reviews.title: Cisco- Valet Plus
customer_reviews.text: This router is the best, not having any experience at all with routers, from the time I opened the box untill I had the network up and running, couldn't have been more than 20 minutes. This is one product that was made with the home user in mind, Great job Cisco
customer_reviews.author: William E. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic!!! We had another brand router we had purchased right before this one and it would not stay connected. A friend recommended this one and since installation (at least a month ago) has not lost its connection once! It has been worth every penny and would recommend it highly. Its nice to be off the roller coaster ride of on and off again internet connection! Thanks Cisco
customer_reviews.author: Caryn Honeycutt

product_meta.title: Cisco-Valet Plus Wireless Router
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER





AMAZON.COM 

INTRODUCING VALET PLUS: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WIRELESS ROUTER
Valet Plus is the surprisingly simple wireless router that gives you the power to quickly and simply make your home wireless. Valet Plus gets you connected to the Internet in just three steps: plug in the included Easy Setup Key, breeze through a few simple screens, and start enjoying the freedom of wireless. Cisco Connect software, pre-loaded on the Easy Setup Key, lets you quickly link your other wireless devices and manage your home wireless with ease. Remember when going wireless required technical expertise and hours of effort? Not anymore--Valet Plus just works. 

 



Valet combines sleek, modern styling with easy
wireless set-up. Click here for a larger image.

KEY FEATURES
 * Valet Plus is the surprisingly simple wireless router that makes it easy to connect your computers, gaming consoles, smart phones, and other devices to the Internet. 
 * Get set up in three simple steps: insert the Easy Setup Key to launch Cisco Connect software, breeze through the simple screens, and you're wireless 
 * Enjoy the speed and range of Wireless-N. 
 * Link additional computers and other devices with easy-to-use Cisco Connect software. 
 * Connect wired devices to Valet Plus for faster transfers of videos and large files. 
 * Enjoy the expanded wireless range offered by Valet Plus--ideal for larger homes. 
 * Use Cisco Connect's customizable Parental Controls to block unwanted websites or restrict Internet usage during certain hours. 



SET UP IN THREE STEPS
Valet Plus gets you connected in just three simple steps. Gone are the days when wireless setup was a frustrating process with lots of complicated steps and confusing terminology. Simply insert the included Easy Setup Key to launch Cisco Connect software, breeze through the simple screens, and you're wireless. It's that easy. 

GET EVERYTHING CONNECTED
Your Valet Plus wireless router empowers you to enjoy all the benefits of your wireless home. Surf the Internet on your laptop, print wirelessly from anywhere in the house, check your email from your smart phone, and even stream your favorite movies and TV shows to your HDTV. Valet Plus makes it all possible. 



Set up in minutes with just a a few simple on-screen steps (see more screenshots from the set-up software).

CUSTOMIZE PARENTAL CONTROLS
Easy-to-use Cisco Connect software lets you set custom parental controls on the wireless devices in your home, so you can keep your children's Internet time safe and fun. Restrict Internet usage during certain hours, block unwanted sites, or ensure age-appropriate content with "Teen" and "Child" settings--and customize these controls by device. With parental controls, you're in charge.

INTERNET FOR EVERYONE
Cisco Connect makes it a breeze to give wireless access to visiting friends and family. Remember when getting a guest connected entailed finding a 15-character password you had jotted down on a piece of paper months earlier? Not anymore. Just open Cisco Connect, and with a few simple clicks of your mouse, you'll have a temporary password you can pass along to your guests--without having to share your personal passwords and private information. Managing your home wireless has never been this easy. 

THE BENEFITS OF VALET PLUS
Just like Valet, Valet Plus gets you set up in minutes and lets you manage your home wireless with ease. Valet Plus also offers better range for larger homes and faster transfers of videos and large files. 

OTHER VALET PRODUCTS


Valet.



Valet Connector.

VALET
 * Create a wireless hotspot in your home and easily connect your computers, gaming consoles, smartphones, and other devices to the Internet. 
 * Get set up in minutes: insert the Easy Setup Key to launch Cisco Connect software, breeze through the simple screens, and you're wireless. 
 * Connect additional computers and other devices with easy-to-use Cisco Connect software. 

VALET CONNECTOR
 * Free yourself from the shackles of unnecessary wires by wirelessly connecting your desktop and laptop PCs to the Internet. 
 * Get set up easily: insert your Valet Connector into the USB port of your wired device, and you'll be wireless in just a few minutes. 
 * Enjoy wireless on the go: take your pocket-sized Valet Connector with you to connect your laptop to hotspots at coffee shops, hotels, and airports.
feature_bullets: Networking Equipment Features: 128-bit Wireless Encryption, WEP Security, WPA2 Security
Computer Platform Compatibility: PC, Windows, Mac

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars568 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
